file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Vaiken Spacedock to Darth Malgus. I have the artifacts of Vodal Kressh.
Then you possess all that remains of the Dark Lord.
Whatever happened down there will not repeat itself. My augurs felt the final destruction of Vodal's spirit.
Vodal--or his chosen servant--was formidable. His power echoes in the Force.
The enemy was strong.
Echoes fade.
A being capable of commanding armies from beyond death. Remarkable.
He had intriguing strength....
Yet he fell, in the end.
All I know is that we won the battle. That's enough for now.
I'll take your word for it.
Indeed.
Enough blaster fire can take care of anyone--or anything.
Just another job.
The beings I fought in Vodal's sanctum--his servants--what were they?
Tell me about those creatures.
Vodal was an alchemist who filled a city with his slaves--it seems their evolution continued in the ruins, and their devotion never faded.
That was horrible.
That was horrible.
I can promise nothing.
As to the artifacts, the Dark Council will choose whether to destroy Vodal's work; I would see his name wiped from our history.
There is no place for Sith Lords who place themselves above the Empire--not among the living or the dead.
Arrogance is never lacking in men of ambition--living or dead.
There will always be traitors.
So we keep watch.
As you say.
Any true Sith would place himself above the Empire, given the chance.
You're naive, Lord Malgus.
The Empire endures where lone Sith are doomed.
We are done for now. Rest, and know you have done the Emperor's will.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
You've arrived at last. Good.
Each of you has seen things no mind is meant to endure--you've struggled against the power of Sith dead for centuries.
I understand you have seen things no mind is meant to endure--you've struggled against the power of Sith dead for centuries.
If you are not willing to face the darkness again, leave now, and I will forget your existence.
We're talking now for a reason. I want to know what's going on.
Tell me why I'm here.
As you wish.
I'm not afraid of conflict.
I'll take that as assent.
I wouldn't think a Darth would forgive cowardice so easily.
That's suspiciously generous.
Broken men are of no use to me.
One thousand years ago, the planet Athiss held the sanctum of Vodal Kressh, greatest of the Sith alchemists.
Vodal was a mad savant, who bred a race of slaves devoted to his glory. His hunger and spite were endless, and when he died, the Emperor declared Athiss forbidden.
Forbidding dangerous knowledge isn't the Sith way. What did the Emperor think would happen?
Why quarantine Vodal's work?
As I said, Vodal was spiteful, and had many servants--in defeat, his followers might spread chaos to the galaxy.
Let me guess: Someone found Vodal's old sanctum.
I assume something's happened.
So? That's ancient history.
Two days ago, we detected a signal from Athiss's surface--we believe a Republic survey party landed and disturbed the ruins.
Something is stirring on the planet. Whether it's idiot explorers or Vodal's mad legacy, it cannot be allowed to escape.
Whatever is on Athiss will fall before me.
I will end Vodal's legacy.
So it must.
If I help you, I'll need to study the teachings of this "savant."
This could be an opportunity.
Your eagerness is understandable--but be cautious.
If Republic agents think they can use a Sith Lord's teachings against us, they're dead wrong.
I'll stop anyone interfering.
Anything in the target area dies. Good enough?
I'll make a clean sweep.
There is more--whatever writings Vodal left behind must also be recovered.
You said Athiss was forbidden. Now you want me to go down there?
What about the Emperor?
The breach has already occurred, and the edict no longer applies. I will take full responsibility.
You're afraid of ghosts, Lord Malgus. A dead man on a dead planet threatens no one.
This sounds like superstition.
Perhaps his teachings are worthless, his devices rusted and his servants dead. Perhaps the Emperor was overcautious--but perhaps not.
Go to Athiss, eliminate whatever prowls Vodal's sanctum and remove the scriptures he left behind.
Let none of Vodal's power fall into enemy hands. Stop them from unleashing something uncontrollable.
